explanation: The stage direction describes a sequence of events and character transformations, which has a narrative quality. It details the actions of characters (Pasquariel turning into a monster and Arlequin engaging in combat), making it more of a storytelling element rather than a simple action or movement description.
stgdir: Pasquariel se change en monstre. Arlequin jette son manteau royal, et paraît monté sur un cheval ailé, combat le monstre, et après un jeu de culbutes, la scène finit.
